content:
I just looked at the CI again and saw:

ubuntu-20.04-xl runner image is now available. The existing ubuntu-latest-xl runner image (based on Ubuntu 18.04 XL) is deprecated and will retire on January 15, 2022. Migrate to ubuntu-20.04-xl instead.

That is... today?

It's comforting to know that the ubuntu XL images get updated much more slowly than the public ones. Maybe that bodes well for the windows-latest-xl migration.

That's also interesting to know that it might be possible to use a version-specific qualifier with the XL images like windows-2019-xl.

@Hans Kratz Have you done any testing to see if there will be any issues?
I have manually run some docker ci builds on a 20.04 server recently and they worked fine. I haven't run all of them and not the full GH action workflow though.
I suspect most of them should be OK, since they don't do much before launching docker.
